Method Detail

write

Status write(User user,
             byte[] data,
             int nbytes)
Write a serial message. Driver code may add end of string terminators to the message but the extra characters are not included in the number of bytes written.

Parameters:
user - The user.
data - The data.
nbytes - The number of bytes to write.
Returns:
The status of the request. If status is Status.error than user.getMessage() returns the reason. If status is Status.success or Status.overflow then user.getInt() returns the number of bytes of data that were written.

read

Status read(User user,
            byte[] data,
            int nbytes)
Read an serial message. If read returns asynSuccess than eomReason (some combination of EOM_CNT, EOM_EOS, and EOM_END) tells why the read completed. Driver code may strip end of string terminators from the message. If it does the the eos characters will not be included in nbytesTransfered.

Parameters:
user - The user.
data - The data.
nbytes - The number of bytes to read.
Returns:
The status of the request. If status is Status.error than user.getMessage() returns the reason. If status is Status.success or Status.overflow then user.getInt returns the number of bytes that were read. If status is Status.overflow than user.getAuxStatus() returns the number of bytes not read. If status is Status.success than user.getAuxStatus() returns the eomMessage.

flush

Status flush(User user)
Flush any input data.

Parameters:
user - The user.
Returns:
The status. If status is Status.error than user.getMessage() returns the reason.

setInputEos

Status setInputEos(User user,
                   byte[] eos,
                   int eosLen)
Set termination characters for input.

Parameters:
user - The user.
eos - The termination string.
eosLen - The number of termination bytes.
Returns:
The status. If status is Status.error than user.getMessage() returns the reason.

getInputEos

Status getInputEos(User user,
                   byte[] eos)
Get termination characters for output.

Parameters:
user - The user.
eos - The termination string.
Returns:
The status. If status is Status.error than user.getMessage() returns the reason. If status is Status.success than user.getAuxStatus() returns the number of termination characters.

addInterruptUser

Status addInterruptUser(User user,
                        SerialInterruptListener serialInterruptListener)
Register a listener for value changes.

Parameters:
user - The user.
serialInterruptListener - The listener interface.
Returns:
The status. If the status is not Status.success than user.message() describes the problem.

removeInterruptUser

Status removeInterruptUser(User user,
                           SerialInterruptListener serialInterruptListener)
Cancel a listener.

Parameters:
user - The user.
serialInterruptListener - The listener interface.
Returns:
The status. If the status is not Status.success than user.message() describes the problem.

interruptOccurred

void interruptOccurred(byte[] data,
                       int nbytes)
An interrupt occurred.

Parameters:
data - The byte array.
nbytes - The number of bytes.
